derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin, said to be from Greek anemōnē 'windflower', literally 'daughter of the wind', from anemos 'wind', thought to be so named because the flowers open only when the wind blows

entry.tran: 银莲花，风花（花色分红、紫、白等颜色的园圃植物）
entry.def: An anemone is a garden plant with red, purple, or white flowers.

means.word_mean: 1. any woodland plant of the genus Anemone grown for its beautiful flowers and whorls of dissected leaves
2. marine polyps that resemble flowers but have oral rings of tentacles; differ from corals in forming no hard skeleton
